thread.title: IMD: Coldwave conditions in some districts of Telangana
thread.title_full: IMD: Coldwave conditions in some districts of Telangana

author: Pavitra Bhashyam
title: IMD: Coldwave conditions in some districts of Telangana
text:
[Telangana News](https://www.news9live.com/state/telangana)
IMD: Coldwave conditions in some districts of Telangana
Coldwave conditions are very likely to prevail in some pockets in Adilabad, Komarambheem Asifabad, Mancherial, Nirmal districts.
Hyderabad: Misty or hazy conditions is very likely to prevail during morning hours at some places in some districts of Telangana on December 13, 14. Minimum temperatures are likely to be below normal (2.0째C-4째C) in some districts during the next three days, India Meteorological Department said in its forecast.
Coldwave conditions are very likely to prevail in some pockets in Adilabad, Komarambheem Asifabad, Mancherial, Nirmal districts over the next three days with the weather department issuing an orange alert. Yellow alert was issued for Hyderabad, Jagtial, Jangaon, Jayashankar Bhupalpalle, Kamareddy, Karimnagar, Medak, Medchal Malkajgiri. Dry weather is likely to prevail over the state later amid the intensifying winter chill.
In its five-day temperature forecast, the weather department said that Adilabad, Komarambheem Asifabad, Mancherial, Nirmal districts will likely record temperatures between 5-10째C while Hyderabad may see temperatures between 11-15 degrees Celsius.
Adilabad records lowest temperature:
On Thursday, Bela in Adilabad recorded the lowest temperature at 7 degrees Celsius and Hyderabad recorded the lowest temperature of 10.9째C at BHEL factory in Sangareddy.
Maximum and minimum temperatures in Hyderabad are likely to be 30 and 18 degrees Celsius respectively. Surface winds are likely to be northerlies/north-easterlies with wind speeds of 4-8 kmph.
